content.body: I gave it a shot, although I'm not a layout person

annevk: When HTTP-redirect fetch is invoked, at this time response's URL list does not contain the location URL, right? In other words, response's URL (last URL list item) is the URL that redirected (to the location URL), right?
content.formatted_body: annevk: When HTTP-redirect fetch is invoked, at this time response's URL list does not contain the location URL, right? In other words, response's URL (last URL list item) is the URL that redirected (to the location URL), right?

content.body: And then I believe we do a bunch of checks, and append the location URL to the request's URL list, and then once we get a response (maybe another redirect), we set the response's URL list to a clone of the request's URL list. Do I have the steps right here?
